revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=D-Link |model=DIR-636L |revision=A1 |upc=790069374449 |asin=B0081TXIXI |est_release_date=05/09/2012 |fcc_date=04/09/2012 |is_manuf=No |manuf=Cameo |type=wireless router |fcc_id=KA2IR636LA1 |ic_id=4216A-IR636LA1 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Ralink |cpu1_model=RT6856 |cpu1_cspeed=700 |fla1=16 MiB |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12845EMI-10G |ram1=128 MiB |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model=M14D1G1664A-2.5B |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=4-pin header,, (57600,8,N,1) |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT5592EPL |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Realtek |sw_model=RTL8367RB |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |stock_boot=U-Boot;1.1.3;Ralink UBoot Version:3.5.2.0; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.36-svn2225;'RALINK' |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=dlink-XXXX |default_ssid_regex=^dlink-[A-F0-9]{4}$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=Admin }} {{TagLine|N300 Gigabit Cloud Router|Cloud Router 1200}} :[http://twqa.mydlink.com/product/DIR636L Product page]
Same basic hardware as the [[D-Link DIR-826L rev A1]]. This device lacks the Mini PCIe socket and the external wireless card. (Solder pads and silkscreen lineout for the mPCIe connector as well as supporting component pads are present, values obviously unknown unless someone can obtain these from a 826L card).
Assumed Cameo device.
(Another brand of the 128MiB SDRAM was: Winbond, W971GG6JB-25)
FCC photos show the device with a Ralink CPU. This device is [http://www.mediatek.com/en/News/news_content.php?sn=1057 using RT6856] and a external Ralink PCIe chip (RT5592EPL?). (If so, the RT5592EPL may possibly have a dual purpose; both as wifi and as a PCIe bridge, as the wifi circuitry and antennas also seems to gravitate towards this chip.)
[http://certifications.wi-fi.org/pdf_certificate.php?cid=WFA14992 Wi-Fi Certified]
The default SSID pattern is presumed to be '''dlink-XXXX'''.
